![wwNDK3d.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/wwNDK3d.jpg)

Personally, I really don't like the Tier 1 and 2 space centers. Too much brown and blues. Doesn't really fit with the space center aesthetic that it should be going for. So the main styles I have here are as follows:

-Converted Industrial Farm (VAB is a grain elevator, maybe not the best idea. Coal mine facility might be better) The low-cost, cheap, but well put together style I was aiming for reflects the RT-5 and RT-10 SRBs. They don't look like junk, and neither should the VAB.

-Alternate Tier 0 (not pictured): Coal (or maybe Ore??) Mine facility repurposed as a space center. They would have all the machinery already there for construction, and some decently big buildings.

-Rocket Testing Grounds (Like Penemunde perhaps. Brown bricks are okay here, but grey concrete might look even better.) Looks entirely neato with the prototype-like liquid fueled rockets of Jeb's Junkyard.

-1950s Rocketpunk Spaceport (From the 1954 Disneyland Tomorrowland documentary Man In Space) Fits the part for the retro-looking Rockomax parts. I really liked the design when I saw it in Man-In-Space, and I figure it could be used as a VAB. In the top image above, you can see the Mission Control Center. It's a blockhouse, which is also seen in the Man-In-Space documentary. It was also designed to look good with the derelict island airport.

-Cape Canaveral space center with real-looking VAB. Looks great with Kerbodyne Saturn/SLS-like parts. No changes would be needed here, we already have the wonderfully brilliant design by Bac9.

There are a whole host of problems with the space centers we got. Texture holes, sub-par quality, Kerbals clipping through ground objects, floating paint lines, conflicting art style with stock parts, etc. It's not horrible, and its a heck of a lot better than the pictures we were shown of the Barn. But it really does feel like it was hastily made, a bit rushed, and not done with as much love and care as Bac9's Tier 3 Space Center from 0.21/22.

I realize it may seem to be a bit too late to redo an entire art asset like this, but it is possible, and I think it could be done a lot better.
